intro: Polyspora tiantangensis, commonly known as the Tiantang polyspora, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions in China. It belongs to the family Polysporaceae and is characterized by its unique morphological features, including its spore-bearing structures. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in mountainous areas with high humidity. Its botanical significance lies in its limited distribution and potential ecological role in its native habitat. Due to habitat loss and environmental changes, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
